bitfield.description: Receive data
Transmit data
Reserved
McBSP emulation mode bit (free mode)
McBSP emulation mode bit (soft mode)
Frame-sync logic reset bit (negative polarity)
Sample rate generator reset bit (negative polarity)
Transmit interrupt mode bits
Transmit frame-sync error bit (Caution: if XINTM = 11b, writing a 1 to XSYNCERR triggers a transmit interrupt just as if a transmit frame-sync error occurred)

bitenum.description: Clear the transmit Frame Sync Error

bitfield.description: Transmitter empty bit (negative polarity)
Transmitter ready bit
Transmitter reset bit (negative polarity)
Digital loopback mode bit
Receive sign-extension and justification mode bits
Clock stop mode bits
Reserved
DX delay enabler mode bit
A-bis mode bit
Receive interrupt mode bits
Receive frame-sync error bit (Caution: If RINTM = 11b, writing a 1 to RSYNCERR triggers a receive interrupt just as if a receive frame-sync error occurred)

bitenum.description: Clear the receive Frame Sync Error

bitfield.description: Receiver full bit
Receiver ready bit
Receiver reset bit (negative polarity)
Receive phase number bit
Receive frame length 2
Receive word length 2
Receive companding mode bits
Receive frame-sync ignore bit
Receive data delay bits
Reserved
Receive frame length 1
Receive word length 1
Receive 32-bit reversal feature 0: 32-bit reversal disabled 1: 32-bit reversal enabled. 32-bit data is received LSB first. RWDLEN should be set for 32-bit operation; else operation is undefined
Reserved
Transmit phase number bit
Transmit frame length 2
Transmit word length 2
Transmit companding mode bits
Transmit frame-sync ignore bit
Transmit data delay bits
Reserved
Transmit frame length 1
Transmit word length 1
Transmit 32-bit reversal feature 0: 32-bit reversal disabled 1: 32-bit reversal enabled. 32-bit data is transmitted LSB first. RWDLEN should be set for 32-bit operation; else operation is undefined
Reserved
Clock synchronization mode bit for CLKG
CLKS pin polarity bit
Sample rate generator input clock mode bit
Sample rate generator transmit frame-sync mode bit
Frame-sync period bits for FSG
Frame-sync pulse width bits for FSG
Divide-down value for CLKG
Reserved
Transmit pin mode configuration This is used to configure the DX pin state while the time slot is disabled 00b: Hi-Z 01b: Driven as 1 10b: Driven as 0 11b: Reserved

Multi-channel mode selection This bit is work with XMCM and XMCME bit to select the operation mode of the McBSP512 XEMODE XMCM XMCME Operation mode 0 00 0 Traditional operation mode 0 01/10/11 0 32 channel normal operation mode 0 xx 1 128 channel normal operation mode 1 00 0 512 channel mode with PDMA
Transmit multichannel partition mode bit
Transmit partition B block bits
Transmit partition A block bits
Transmit current block indicator
Transmit multichannel selection mode bits

bitenum.description: All Transmitter Channels are enabled and masked

bitfield.description: Reserved

Multi-channel mode selection This bit is work with RMCM and RMCME bit to select the operation mode of the McBSP512 REMODE RMCM RMCME Operation mode 0 00 0 Traditional operation mode 0 01/10/11 0 32 channel normal operation mode 0 xx 1 128 channel normal operation mode 1 00 0 512 channel mode with PDMA
Receive multichannel partition mode bit
Receive partition B block bits
Receive partition A block bits
Receive current block indicator
Reserved
Receive multichannel selection mode bit

register.description: Receive Synchronization Event Channel Identification Register

bitfield.description: The time slot (channel number) which send out the synchronization event

register.description: Transmit Synchronization Event Channel Identification Register

bitfield.description: The time slot (channel number) which send out the synchronization event
Used to extend the receive frame length to 512 channels (words / frame)
Used to extend the receive frame length to 512 channels (words / frame)
The number of frame synchronization pulse that must be received before the EN_SYNC pulse is created (for the super-frame synchronization)
The number of frame synchronization pulse that must be received before the EN_SYNC pulse is created (for the super-frame synchronization)
Identifies the Type of peripheral
Identifies the class of the McBSP512 peripheral
Identifies the revision level of the McBSP512
